intro: Miconia pozoensis, commonly known as the Pozo River miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in the Amazon Basin. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Miconia pozoensis is often found in moist, shaded understory habitats within humid forests. Its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets make it an important component of the local flora, though it can also be invasive in certain environments.
